Patent Information.Patent Title: Antimicrobial peptides and methods for identifying and using such peptides.
Patent Information.Abstract: This invention relates to a method for identifying peptides having antimicrobial activity and to the antimicrobial peptides identified thereby and methods for their use.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Fungi:Eimeria acervulina sporozoites, E. tenella sporozoites, Toxoplasma gondii tachyzoites (low activity).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.11849705]1.60% hemolytic activity at 100 μM against human erythrocytes,1.57% hemolytic activity at 100 μM against rabbit erythrocytes,1.42% hemolytic activity at 100 μM against chicken erythrocytes,
Sequence Information.Structure Description: In the absence of an interface, PW2 is in random coil conformation. In micelles, structural calculation shows that Trp-7 forms the hydrophobic core that is important for the peptide folding. Lys-4, Tyr-6, Trp-8, and Arg-9 are in the same surface, possibly facing the micelle interface. (Ref.2)
Sequence Information.Function: Synthetic PW2 shows anticoccidial activity against E. acervulina and Eimeria tenella with very low hemolytic activity. It also displays antifungal activity but no activity against bacteria.(Ref.2)

Literature.Title: Avian anticoccidial activity of a novel membrane-interactive peptide selected from phage display libraries.
Literature.Author: da Silva A Jr, Kawazoe U, Freitas FF, Gatti MS, Dolder H, Schumacher RI, Juliano MA, da Silva MJ, Leite A.

Literature.Title: NMR structure of PW2 bound to SDS micelles. A tryptophan-rich anticoccidial peptide selected from phage display libraries.
Literature.Author: co LW, Da Silva A Jr, Leite A, Valente AP, Almeida FC.
